intro: Brachystelma nepalense, commonly known as the Nepal stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to the Himalayan regions of Nepal and northern India. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which includes many drought-tolerant, flowering plants. The plant features fleshy, cylindrical stems that store water, allowing it to survive in arid conditions. Its small, star-shaped flowers are typically yellow or white, appearing in late summer. Brachystelma nepalense is often found growing on rocky substrates at high altitudes.
